page.title: 03Ecology of Evie
page.content: GRASSLAND: Agricultural grasses are sown in which grow many wild flowers including various{Orchids, Campion, {Birds-Foot Trefoil}and{Cuckoo Flowers. In wet areas we find{Yellow Flag, {Marsh Cinque Foil, Meadow Sweet, Wild {Mint}and{Bog Bean. } The{Snipe}nests in the marshy places {Lapwings}like wet agricultural fields while{Curlews, Redshanks}and{Oyster {Catchers}come in to feed when fields are cut. {Collar Doves}which have only come to Orkney in the last 20 years sit around the farms to feed on grain. At Woodwick, a tree growing area, are found birds typical of woodland areas, plus unusual birds for Orkney, like the{Chaffinch.} This year for the first time, the{Greenfinch}nested here and the{Eyebrowed Thrush}visited us on route from Siberia to India. { }
